It's called 'Film Noir' people, they are usually shot or stylized in black and white to emphasis the shadow and light which represent mood.

/pulling rank with fancy uni degree
i love the old black and white films but there is no need to make films in black and white today so i wont be watching this then

This is so not the way to adapt a graphic novel to the big screen, it does not work on so many levels,take half the actors from an old Guy Ritchie flick, an unbelievably bad supporting cast, throw in a dire script, mix in some cheap production values and your half way there to describing this low budget, made on a shoestring British gangster movie.It is so full of clichÃ©s and annoying effects especially the filming in black and white with the touch of "Schindler's list" using the hint of red to denote danger and death.This is what happens when a director tries to emulate a film like Sin City without a budget, script and most of all talent.Total waste of one hundred minutes of your life.

quality is ok for a 700mb file but DAMN what a disappointment.

A hint for the film makers (and the poor folks enduring this film) - shooting a film in black and white does not make it a film noir.

and this is not one, even though the basic premise might hint at it.
 Sorry, dont want to offend anyone, if you enjoyed it great. but it is a giant insult to the few neo-noirs actually deserving of the name to call this poorly acted and executed piece of shit "film noir".
its not cheap just because its in black and white. they made it that way because they wanted too. lol damn
